p: Finally, gaps remain in our understanding of influenza biology and immunity and methods to produce highly effective vaccines. To close those gaps, it will be important to align the interests of all the stakeholders preparing for the next pandemic. Priorities of public health officials in lower-, middle-, and high-income countries, academic researchers, regulatory bodies, major funders, and pharmaceutical companies must be understood and collectively addressed to face the logistical and scientific challenges ahead [ 24]. Thanks to scientific and technological breakthroughs of the past decade, vaccinology is experiencing a revolution. May we find the resolve, political will, and new business plans to take full advantage of these new opportunities and prepare ourselves before the next pandemic arrives.
